name: Dinner Tonight: Linguine With Squash, Bacon, and Goat Cheese
description: I've done this before. Not with the same ingredients, or procedure, but with the unlikely combo of pasta and seemingly inappropriate vegetable. It would seem to be too much starch for any one human to take on. But cooked correctly,...
recipeIngredient: 1 two- to three-pound squash, peeled and diced

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the bacon in a large pot until nice and crisp. Remove the pieces, and keep about 2 tablespoons of the fat. Toss in the squash and garlic and cook for 5 minutes over medium heat.
Pour in the chicken broth and season with salt. Bring to a simmer, cover, and let be for 25 minutes.
With about ten minutes left, cook the pasta according to the instructions on the box.
Add half of the goat cheese and salt to the squash. Mix well. Then dump in the pasta, and mix again.
Plate the pasta, crumble the other half of the goat cheese over top, and season with more salt and pepper. Crumble the cooked bacon over it all and serve up.
